subject: Philosophy
title: Do You Have Free Will?
description: A 60-second lesson on Do You Have Free Will?.

hook.text: You chose to read this. Or did your brain decide three seconds before you became aware of 'choosing'?

buildup.text: Benjamin Libet's experiment found brain activity for decisions occurs before people report deciding.

discovery.text: If the brain decides before 'you' do, the conscious experience of choosing may be an afterthought.

twist.text: Some scientists conclude free will is an illusion. Others say Libet's experiment doesn't prove what people think.

climax.text: The debate rages. If free will is an illusion, our entire system of morality and law needs rethinking.

punchline.text: You feel free. But feeling free and being free may not be the same.

quiz.question: What did Libet's experiment suggest?
options: Brain activity precedes conscious awareness of a decision
Free will is proven to exist
